intro: Schizocardia, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to southern Africa. The plants typically have basal leaves that are lanceolate or ovate in shape, often with a hairy surface. Schizocardia species produce small, yellow flowers that are arranged in composite heads, characteristic of the Asteraceae family. These plants are often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in dry and sunny conditions.
